Examples

This page shows practical usage examples of pyFuRNAce scripting interfaces.

Basics usage

Two helices with FLAPs

 1import pyfurnace as pf
 2from pyfurnace.generate import generate_road
 3
 4line1 = [pf.TetraLoop(),
 5         pf.Stem(7),
 6         pf.Dovetail(-2, up_cross=False),
 7         pf.Stem(6),
 8         pf.KissingDimer(),
 9         pf.Stem(6),
10         pf.Dovetail(-2, up_cross=False),
11         pf.Stem(4),
12         pf.Broccoli(),
13         pf.Stem(4),
14         pf.TetraLoop(True),
15         ]
16
17line2 = [pf.TetraLoop(),
18         pf.Stem(7),
19         pf.Dovetail(-2, down_cross=False),
20         pf.Stem(10),
21         pf.start_end_stem(),
22         pf.Stem(10),
23         pf.Dovetail(-2, down_cross=False),
24         pf.Stem(7),
25         pf.TetraLoop(True),
26         ]
27
28origami = pf.Origami(line1, line2, aling='center')
29
30print(origami)
31print(origami.structure)
32print(origami.sequence)
33
34### Optimization
35constraints = origami.sequence
36constraints = 'GGGA' + constraints[4:]
37
38sequence = generate_road(origami.structure,
39                         sequence=constraints,
40                         pseudoknots=origami.pseudoknots)
41
42origami.sequence = sequence
43print(origami)
44origami.save_3d_model('basic_origami')
45origami.save_fasta('basic_origami')

RNA droplets notebook

  • RNA droplets
    • Droplet A with Malachite Green aptamer
    • Droplet B with Broccoli aptamer
 1import pyfurnace as pf
 2from pyfurnace.generate import generate_road
 3
 4line1 = [pf.TetraLoop(),
 5         pf.Stem(7),
 6         pf.Dovetail(-2, up_cross=False),
 7         pf.Stem(6),
 8         pf.KissingDimer(),
 9         pf.Stem(6),
10         pf.Dovetail(-2, up_cross=False),
11         pf.Stem(4),
12         pf.Broccoli(),
13         pf.Stem(4),
14         pf.TetraLoop(True),
15         ]
16
17line2 = [pf.TetraLoop(),
18         pf.Stem(7),
19         pf.Dovetail(-2, down_cross=False),
20         pf.Stem(10),
21         pf.start_end_stem(),
22         pf.Stem(10),
23         pf.Dovetail(-2, down_cross=False),
24         pf.Stem(7),
25         pf.TetraLoop(True),
26         ]
27
28origami = pf.Origami(line1, line2, aling='center')
29
30print(origami)
31print(origami.structure)
32print(origami.sequence)
33
34### Optimization
35constraints = origami.sequence
36constraints = 'GGGA' + constraints[4:]
37
38sequence = generate_road(origami.structure,
39                         sequence=constraints,
40                         pseudoknots=origami.pseudoknots)
41
42origami.sequence = sequence
43print(origami)
44origami.save_3d_model('basic_origami')
45origami.save_fasta('basic_origami')

ROAD origami

Contents:

  • A collection of origami desinged by ROAD

Advanced

RNA filament

 1import pyfurnace as pf
 2
 3# MAKE A SIMPLE TILE AND CLEANUP
 4origami = pf.simple_origami(dt_list=[120], 
 5                            kl_columns=1, 
 6                            main_stem=[22],
 7                            add_terminal_helix=True, 
 8                            align="first", 
 9                            use_angles=True) 
10
11# Adjust the length of the stems with Tetraloops
12origami[(1, 7)].length = 5
13origami[(1, 1)].length = 5
14
15# Adjust the length of the stems with external KL
16origami[(0, 7)].length = 7 
17origami[(2, 7)].length = 8 
18origami[(2, 1)].length = 6
19origami[(0, 1)].length = 7 
20
21# Replace the tetraloops with kissing loops in the first and last helix
22origami[(0, 0)] = pf.KissingLoop180(open_left = False, pk_index = "1")
23origami[(2, 0)] = pf.KissingLoop180(open_left = False, pk_index = "2")
24origami[(0, 8)] = pf.KissingLoop180(open_left = True, pk_index = "2'")
25origami[(2, 8)] = pf.KissingLoop180(open_left = True, pk_index = "1'")
26
27# Make three tiles
28tile = origami.copy()
29n_tiles = 3
30
31for i in range(n_tiles - 1):
32    # add and empty line, it will be filled when
33    # the columns are repeated
34    origami.append([])
35
36    # add the tile to the origami
37    for line in tile:
38        origami.append(line, copy=True)
39
40
41# REPEATE THE COLUMNS
42n_columns = 2
43
44# This is gonna be the basic column
45column = origami.copy()
46for col_ind in range(1, n_columns):
47
48
49    # add two empty lines, it will be filled when
50    # the columns are repeated
51    origami.append([])
52    origami.append([])
53    
54    # # add the column to the origami
55    for line_ind, line in enumerate(column):
56        line_index = line_ind + 2 * col_ind
57        insert_at = (line_index, len(origami[line_index]))
58        origami.insert(insert_at, line)
59
60
61# Join adjacent 180 KL to kissing dimers
62for y, line in enumerate(origami):
63
64    # go through the line in reverse order
65    for i in range(len(line) -1, 0, -1):
66
67        # if the two adjacent motifs are kissing loops
68        # pop the one and replace the other with a kissing dimer
69        if type(line[i]) == pf.KL180 and type(line[i-1]) == pf.KL180:
70            origami.pop((y,i))
71            origami[y, i-1] = pf.KissingDimer()
72

Full folding barrier optimization

  1from itertools import product
  2import pyfurnace as pf
  3
  4### ORIGAMI PARAMETERS
  5dovetails_list = [-3, -3]
  6kl_columns = 3
  7kl_delay = 150 # nucleotides delay to claculate the folding barrier
  8
  9# collection of best configurations
 10# a configuration is a tuple of the form (stem_pos, best_start_position)
 11best_confs = []
 12total_min = float('inf')
 13n_helix = len(dovetails_list) + 2
 14
 15starts = list(product(range(0, n_helix - 1), repeat=n_helix-1))[::-1]
 16
 17### Find the best start position
 18for stem_pos in starts:
 19
 20    ### Usually the central helices are not a good start position (heuristic)
 21    # Avoiding central helices screens out a lot of configurations, so
 22    # uncomment the next lines if you want to test them
 23
 24    ### FILTERING OUT CENTRAL HELICES
 25    # skip = False
 26    # for h in range(3, n_helix - 3):
 27    #     if h in stem_pos:
 28    #         skip = True
 29    #         break
 30    # if skip:
 31    #     continue
 32    ### END OF FILTERING
 33
 34    print('Stem pos:', stem_pos)
 35
 36    # Create the origami with the given stem positions
 37    # and no start/end stem
 38    origami = pf.simple_origami(dovetails_list, 
 39                                kl_columns=kl_columns,
 40                                main_stem=33, 
 41                                stem_pos=stem_pos, 
 42                                align='first',
 43                                add_start_end=False)
 44
 45
 46    start_barrier = origami.assembled.folding_barriers(kl_delay=kl_delay)[1]
 47    print('Start barrier:', start_barrier)
 48    
 49
 50    db, stacks = pf.dot_bracket_to_stacks(origami.structure)
 51    min = start_barrier
 52    best_middle = 0
 53    for db, (start, end) in zip(db, stacks):
 54        if db not in '()':
 55            continue
 56        pos = (start + end) // 2
 57        new_strucutre = pf.rotate_dot_bracket(origami.structure, pos)
 58        new_bar = pf.folding_barriers(structure=new_strucutre, kl_delay=kl_delay)[1]
 59        if new_bar < min:
 60            min = new_bar
 61            best_middle = pos
 62            best_structure = new_strucutre
 63        if new_bar < total_min:
 64            total_min = new_bar
 65            best_confs = [(stem_pos, pos)]
 66        elif new_bar == total_min:
 67            best_confs.append((stem_pos, pos))
 68
 69    print('Best start:', best_middle, 'Barrier:', min)
 70
 71    print()
 72
 73print('Best min penalty:', total_min)
 74print('Best confs:')
 75for conf in best_confs:
 76    print('Main stem positions:', conf[0], 'Best start position:', conf[1])
 77
 78# Make the origami with the best configuration
 79best_stem_pos = best_confs[0][0]
 80best_start_pos = best_confs[0][1]
 81origami = pf.simple_origami(dovetails_list, 
 82                            kl_columns=kl_columns,
 83                            main_stem=33, 
 84                            stem_pos=best_stem_pos, 
 85                            align='first',
 86                            add_start_end=False)
 87
 88# Add the start/end stem, but check the orientation
 89for flip in range(2):
 90
 91    # create a copy of the origami, get the slice and the motif
 92    ori_copy = origami.copy()
 93    start_slice = origami.get_slice_at_seq_index(best_start_pos)
 94    m = origami[start_slice]
 95
 96    ### IMPORTANT REMARK:
 97    ### THIS ASSUMENTS THE MOTIF HAS A LENGTH PROPERTY
 98    stem_1 = pf.Stem(m.length // 2)
 99    start_end = pf.start_end_stem()
100    if flip:
101        start_end.flip()
102    stem2 = pf.Stem(m.length - stem_1.length)
103    ori_copy[start_slice] = [stem_1, start_end, stem2]
104
105    # This is the good origami, save it
106    if ori_copy.folding_barriers(kl_delay=kl_delay)[1] == total_min:
107        origami = ori_copy
108        break
109
110print('Example origami:')
111print(origami)

Filament notebook

  • RNA filaments assembly tutorial
    • Create a basic RNA structure
    • Adjust the ends to make a tile
    • Repeat the tiles to make a filament section
    • Repeat the sections to make a filament
    • Generete the sequence for a tile
